TopicTitle: IS BREAKING GROUND REALLY WORTH IT?

Articles.Content:
Hello. I’m wondering if the Breaking Ground expansion is really worth the price. Thanks for the data

Spoiler
It's worth it. Brings in a whole lot of cool parts plus the robotics and propellers add so much more to the game
Resounding yes. Playing without it feels like playing half a game.
It is difficult to get a hold of the concepts of what you can do, but once you do, there is practically no limit. Except for the kraken.
I'm currently in the middle of a mission involving a collapsible construction vehicle for building a Mun base, and I'm also designing a shuttle with hydraulic landing legs, all using Breaking Ground.
Yes its worth it! there are mods that do the things here but i find it way easier and have a faster running game with BG
The Deployable Science (especially the seismometer) is the main reason I bought it. No other mod (that I'm aware of) has that. I'm sure I'll figure out the robotics soon enough.

Breaking ground is great and totally worth it, it's just that you have to be experienced with SSTOs and interplanetary landing before you buy it, otherwise, it doesn't do much except scan stuff on kerbin.
yes. it is, in my opinion, the better of the dlcs

On 11/14/2020 at 8:59 PM, sir rocket said:

yes. it is, in my opinion, the better of the dlcs

Your Opinion is invalid, it brought the science arm, and hinges, and props, but the other brought moar rocket parts and moar rocket sizes. But to answer the question, yes, BG is worth it 10000%

On 11/14/2020 at 8:59 PM, sir rocket said:

yes. it is, in my opinion, the better of the dlcs

I think not, breaking ground is only for "advanced players", while making history is better for everyone because of the moar rocket parts, which could then lead noobs to interplanetary landings. After you are an ace, get breaking ground.
I think that  without it  boring to play

On 11/19/2020 at 1:52 PM, Mikenike said:

Your Opinion is invalid, it brought the science arm, and hinges, and props, but the other brought moar rocket parts and moar rocket sizes. But to answer the question, yes, BG is worth it 10000%

Can someone's opinion really be invalid?
I play breaking ground on KSP Enhanced editon and it just brings a whole lot of diversity. And it also seems that my imagination can now go wilder.

In my opinion, Breaking Ground is definitely worth it, I am at least 97% sure  . I adds in a bunch of robotic parts which you can use for anything from airbrakes to gantry cranes to rover ramps to centrifuges, as well as rover arms, and cargo containers (although I think now the containers are in stock KSP. I have built many mobile and gantry cranes with Breaking Ground. Check on the Steam Workshop for my "Kiebherr KTM 1120-4.1 mobile crane"; any crane enthusiasts will understand this. Also, depending on how long you want to wait, there is probably going to be some kind of sale on Steam for the DLC at some point, if that's what you're using.

Edited February 12, 2021 by Ben J. Kerman
Forgot rover arms

Electric propeller powered planes for places where jets won’t work (like Eve, or inside Jool’s atmosphere!); long(ish) term deployable science experiments that your crew can set up after landing then leave them to gather science over time or by smashing stuff into the surface; surface features that you can sample or scan for even more science, plus some rover scanning arms much like real rovers have on them; not to mention all the crazy contraptions you can build with robotic parts and a sequence programmer- model engines and gearboxes, functioning clocks, giant trebuchets to lob Keebals at the Island Airfield... And that’s not even mentioning the cool new spacesuit with neon glow lights on it! Everything is better with neon glow lights on it!
I wasn’t a huge fan of MH but got Breaking Ground while on sale and actually love it, would’ve paid full price. Adds some useful parts and tools and definitely enhances the game IMO
